isis.stitle: VT-365 Diesel Engine Diagnostics (2002) - DIAGNOSTIC SOFTWARE OPERATION - Diagnostic Tests - Key On Engine Running Tests

svcsubproc.title: Standard Test
svcsubproc.para: The Standard Test checks the operation of the Injection Control Pressure (ICP) system.

During the test, the ECM commands the IPR through a Step Test to determine if the ICP system is performing as expected. The ECM monitors signal values from the ICP sensor and compares those values to the expected values. When the test is done, the ECM returns the engine to the normal operating mode and transmits any DTCs set during the test.

step1.para: Select Diagnostics from the menu bar.
Select Key On Engine Running Tests from the drop down menu.
From the Key On Engine Off Diagnostics menu, select Standard Test, and click Run to start the test.

svcsubproc.para: The ECM increases engine idle to a pre-determined value and commands the IPR valve to set ICP to rated speed pressure. If the performance of the ICP system is acceptable, the ECM will control the IPR valve and reduce the pressure in steps, while continuing to monitor the ICP system.

note.para: Before doing this test, confirm the following conditions:

item.para: Problems causing Active DTCs were corrected, and active DTCs were cleared.
Engine coolant temperature must be at least 70°C (158°F).
Battery voltage must be higher than 12.5 volts.
No signal from Vehicle Speed Sensor (VSS)

svcsubproc.para: When the test is done, the ECM restores normal engine operation, and the Diagnostics Trouble Code window will display DTCs, if there are problems.

svcsubproc.title: Continuous Monitor Test

specpara.para: This test can only be done with the EST; Master Diagnostics software is required.

svcsubproc.para: The Continuous Monitor Test troubleshoots intermittent connections at sensors and actuators. The engine can be off or running.
The EST monitors the following circuits:

step1.para: Select Diagnostics from the menu bar.
Select Key On Engine Running Tests from the drop down menu.
From the Key On Engine Running Diagnostics menu, select Continuous Monitor Test, and click Run to start the test.

warning.para: To prevent serious personal injury, possible death, or damage to the engine or vehicle - comply with the following:
Be careful to avoid rotating parts (belts and fan) and hot engine surfaces.

step1.para: Wiggle connectors and wires at all suspected problem locations. If circuit continuity is interrupted, the EST will beep and display DTCs related to the condition.

svcsubproc.title: Air Management Test

specpara.para: This test can only be done with the EST; Master Diagnostics software is required. The Standard Test must be done before doing the Air Management Test.

svcsubproc.para: The Air Management Test checks the operation of the Air management System and the following valves:

item.para: Electronic Variable Response Turbocharger (EVRT™)Control Valve (also called VGT control valve)

svcsubproc.para: During the Air Management test, the ECM commands the EVRT™ (VGT control valve) and EGR actuators through a step test sequence to determine if actuators and the Air Management System are performing as expected. The ECM monitors the feedback signal values from the exhaust back pressure sensor and compares those values to the expected values.
When the test is done, the ECM restores normal engine operation, and the Diagnostics Trouble Code window will display DTCs, if there are problems.

step1.para: Select Diagnostics from the menu bar.
Select Key On Engine Running Tests from the drop down menu.
From Key On Engine Running Diagnostics menu, select Air Management Test. and click Run to start the test.

svcsubproc.para: The ECM increases engine idle speed, commands the VGT vanes to fully open, and allows EBP to stabilize. The ECM then measures and compares the pressures to expected values; pressures are expected to drop. If presssures do not meet expected values, a DTC is set and the test is cancelled.

The ECM then commands the VGT vanes to fully closed, while measuring and comparing the pressures to expected values; pressures are expected to increase. If pressures do not meet expected values, a DTC is set and the test is cancelled.
The ECM commands VGT vanes to fully open; pressures are expected to drop. If pressures do not meet expected values, a DTC is set and the test is cancelled.

If pressures are as expected, the test will continue and test EGR. The ECM commands VGT vanes to fully closed, while measuring and comparing the pressures to expected values; pressures are expected to increase. If pressures do not meet expected values, a DTC is set and the test is cancelled.
The ECM then commands the EGR to open and compares the EBP signal to expected values; pressure is expected to drop. If pressure does not meet expected values, a DTC is set and the test is cancelled.

The ECM then commands the EGR to close and compares EBP to expected values; pressure is expected to increase. If pressures do not meet expected values, a DTC is set and the engine will return to normal operating mode.

svcsubproc.title: EVRT™ Test

specpara.para: This test can only be done with the EST; Master Diagnostics software is required. The Standard Test must be done before doing the EVRT™ Test.

svcsubproc.para: The EVRT™ Test is a manual test that allows the technician to set the VGT duty to low, medium, or high and inspect the exhaust system for leaks.

note.para: EVRT™ can be monitored by listening to exhaust sound, as duty is changed.

step1.para: Select Diagnostics from the menu bar.
Select Key On Engine Running Tests from the drop down menu.
From Key On Engine Running Diagnostics menu, select the one of the following EVRT™ Tests, and click Run tostart the test.

svcsubproc.para: If the ECM does not receive a request from the EST, after about 2 minutes, the test will automatically end and the engine will return to normal operation.
